incidents.name: Can't switch back to parent account

incident_updates.body: Clicking on “return to the parent account” will not return you to the parent account and keeps you logged in as the subuser.

incidents.name: [Retroactive] Event Webhook Posting Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team identified, investigated and corrected an unexpected issue today with the Twilio SendGrid Event Webhook. This optional feature, under normal conditions, allows receiving event data in real time based on email sent via a Twilio SendGrid account. However, between the times of 2:20 PM and 3:30 PM PT, a subset of accounts that had this feature enabled experienced delays to normal event posting due to the issue. Not all accounts with webhook enabled were affected by this delay, and no event data was lost. This issue did not affect mail send. All event postings that were impacted with delays during this period are now processing properly, and all systems are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Emails delayed

incident_updates.body: Between 3:41 PM PT until 3:56 PM PT, on March 27th, our Engineers identified an issue that affected mail send. A subset of customers may have experienced latency in mail send getting processed. A fix has been implemented, and this issue has been resolved. All delayed mail send has been processed.

incidents.name: SendGrid User Interface Errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that the user interface console issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have completed the work to fix the console errors, and we are now monitoring console performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes to confirm this issue has been resolved.

Our team identified that, based on a deploy that had occurred earlier today, some accounts became unable to view required console resources which resulted in errors shown when navigating the SendGrid console user interface. Work is being done to correct accounts that are still experiencing the 'We encountered an error' issue to allow proper navigation of the console. Another update will be provided within 1 hour or as soon as the work has been complete.

We are still continuing to investigate the stated user interface errors. Please note that this has been confirmed to only impact a subset of user accounts. Another update will be provided in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate an issue in which users navigating the SendGrid user interface experience an error stating 'We encountered an error'. We appreciate your patience while this issue continues to be explored. Another update will be provided in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We’re currently investigating an intermittent issue within the SendGrid interface causing a 'We encountered an error' message when navigating to any page. Our team began investigating this around 11:30 AM PT. Our team is actively working on a resolution and we will provide an update in 30 minutes or sooner.

incidents.name: Accepting SendGrid Teammate invites failing with error.

incident_updates.body:
Starting around 12:26 MT, Mar 24th, our engineers identified an issue where customers were unable to accept new teammate invitations. Our engineers have resolved the issue as of 11:30 MST, March 25th.

Users should now accept invites without any trouble.

We appreciate your patience and apologize for any inconvenience caused.

This issue has been resolved and all transactional mail should be received as expected. If you did not receive expected transactional emails from SendGrid, please re-request those emails as you should now receive them.

incidents.name: Unsubscribe check failures causing billing issues

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Marketing Campaign emails has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance regarding charges associated to emails being sent to unsubscribed addresses. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

At 11:50 PST our engineers identified the cause of the issue and started working towards a solution. The engineering team is currently performing tests to implement the fix. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11 AM PST on March 6, 2025, our engineers identified an issue where Marketing Campaign emails, including Automations and Single Sends, are generating charges in customer billing even if the email was dropped due to being in the Unsubscribed suppression list. As such, the situation might impact the user’s billing. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Retroactive Incident - Twilio SendGrid Email Processing Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with email processing delays between 6:25AM to 6:32AM PT on February 13, 2025.  A small subset of customers that send mail using the API, SMTP, or Marketing may have experienced email processing delays. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Retroactive Incident - Missing Data for Legacy and Standard Email Activity

incident_updates.body: Between January 30th, 2025 and February 5th, 2025, a problem occurred with some storage and availability of SendGrid email activity data. Our engineering team identified that this incident only impacted a subset of customers specifically sending via the EU with regionalized sub users. Ongoing impact due to the root cause has been mitigated since February 5th. While impacted email activity data during the affected period for EU sub users is still being investigated for the possibility of restoration, please reach out to our support team if you require assistance and believe to have been affected by this issue.

incidents.name: Brazil customers not able to open support tickets for logging issues

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated the issue and determined that it is specific to certain browsers. We recommend that customers use a different browser to access the Support Help Center if they are experiencing this issue.

Starting around 2:10pm PST on Feb 12th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the SendGrid Help Center where unauthenticated customers located in Brazil are not being able to escalate login issues. When clicking the "Trouble Logging In" or "Forgot my Username" link,  they are redirected to a "Not logged in" page. This does not impact mail send or authenticated customers who know their username and password. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Inbound Parse Senderauth Domain Error

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Inbound Parse creation has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Inbound Parse creation should no longer result in an error when attempting to use an authenticated domain. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.

Starting at 2:00PM PST on January 24th, 2025, our engineers began investigating an error encountered while configuring Inbound Parse: "In order to create a parse setting you must have a matching senderauth domain" This is preventing users from setting up their Inbound Parse, despite having authenticated domains on their accounts. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Links in emails resulting in 'Site can't be reached' error.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have concluded the monitoring status and now all services are back to normal. Links can now be accessed. This incident is officially resolved.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are currently monitoring the results of all services. We'll be monitoring the fix and provide more updates as soon as they become available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, our engineers are actively looking to understand the root cause and we will be providing updates as soon as they become available.

Starting around 3 AM on 22nd November, 2024 our engineers began investigating an issue with clicking SSL click tracked links in emails wherein the recipients are receiving 500 Origin Error. The origin server is not reachable or returns an error.

The issue has only been observed so far for customers using KeyCDN for their SSL click tracking configuration.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Click Tracking degradation

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with click tracking has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

As of approximately 1:30 AM PST on Thursday, November 21, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue impacting Click Tracking URLs using 'ct.sendgrid.net'.

This issue affects customers who have enabled click tracking but have not configured link branding.

This does not affect mail send.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermmittent login issues after adding credentials

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. All systems are operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are monitoring the results, we will provide an update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available

Starting 6:43 AM PT (exact time will be determined soon), our engineers began investigating issues when accessing the account using credentials as username and password. When adding the right credentials, users receive an error of 'Your username or password is invalid'. 

This is only affecting password users, meaning that SSO users are not affected.

This does not affect mail send.

Customers seem to have success accessing the account by retrying again or using an incognito window. Our engineers are currently investigating the current behavior and will provide an update within an hour or as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Multiple deferral due to Internal Server Error message

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with deferrals occurring with Internal Server Error has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers are continue to monitor system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix for the deferral events. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

SendGrid engineers are continuing to investigate the issue. Email sends may experience an increase in email deferrals; however, there is currently no loss of emails being observed. The emails that are deferred are being retried and successfully delivering. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

SendGrid engineers are actively investigating the issue. Email sends may experience an increase in email deferrals; however, there is currently no loss of emails being observed. The emails that are deferred are being retried and successfully delivering. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

Our engineers kept working on the incident and noticed that the incident was broader than previously anticipated. 

We will move our incident to Investigating so we can confirm the actual scope of the issue and work towards a correct fix. 

Updates will be provided within the next hour or as soon as more information becomes available

Starting around 5.15 AM PST, October 25th, our engineers began investigating issues with the SendGrid delivery platform where some users were affected by multiple deferrals under the reason 'Internal server error' and similar errors that prevented emails from being delivered.

Issue has been identified and a fix has been deployed. We are monitoring the last errors since and will update on the impact. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

incidents.name: Mail Send Delays and API Call Errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with Mail send Delays and API Call Errors. From 1:18 PM Pacific Time to 1:28 PM Pacific Time on Friday, October 18th, customers may have experienced delays in mail sending and issues with API calls causing errors. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Customers facing signup failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with signup failures has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers are still monitoring system performance and no further updates are available at the moment to provide. We will provide more updates within the next hours or as soon as more info becomes available

Starting around 4:40 am PDT on 10/18/2024, we started observing some user signup failures. Engineering teams are triaging the impact. This does not affect mail send. We will provide another update in an hour, or as soon as updates become available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Website Accessibility Outage

incident_updates.body: We experienced a temporary outage today, affecting access to www.sendgrid.com from 8:03 AM PDT to 8:16 AM PDT. During this period, customers may have encountered difficulties connecting to the site. Please note that this issue did not impact access to the console or API. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your understanding.

incidents.name: Contact Ingestion Delayed affecting New Marketing Campaigns for subset of customers

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 min or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers identified the root cause of the errors and are working towards deploying a fix. We will provide another update in 30 min or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at approximately 2 PM PST, our engineering team began investigating delays in contact ingestion for new marketing campaigns affecting a subset of customers. We will provide another update within the next hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Delayed teammate creation for small segment of users

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with teammates during the previous database interruption has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

As of 11:15am PST, SendGrid engineers are aware that a small group of ~250 users who created teammates during the previous database interruption that are still delayed. We have identified the users and will run updates to ensure that all teammates are created correctly. You do not need to take any action at this time. For all other users, all systems are currently working as expected, this is only for some previously created users. We will provide an update in two hours or once we have more details.

Currently, several API’s including mailsettings and mail acceptance have been affected. Users may experience intermittent delay with mail delivery. incidents.name: Non-Unified Account Email Address Change Notifications Not Sending

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue with Email Address Change Notifications not sending. This issue only affected accounts not Unified with Twilio. From Sept 19th at 1:24PM PT to Sept 23rd at 12:10PM PT, customers leveraging non-Unified accounts may not have received email address change verification emails. Any requested email changes made by these accounts during this window would need to be re-triggered on the user end. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Issues with Domain Authentication

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Domain authentication has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

A fix has been implemented by the third party provider. We are currently monitoring our system while the provider processes the authentication requests submitted earlier. It will take a few hours for all pending requests to be processed. We will provide another update in two hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10:07 AM PDT on Wednesday, 09/18/2024, our Engineers identified an issue impacting new domain authentications. Due to a third-party provider, customers won't be able to authenticate new domains despite the DNS records being correctly added on their side, and won't be able to send emails on behalf of those domains until the authentication is complete. This issue doesn't affect the domains that have been authenticated and therefore, it doesn't impact email sending for them. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

components.name: Website
components.description: Availability of SendGrid.com

incidents.name: Unrecognized 2FA codes prevented login to SendGrid accounts

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue preventing access to the SendGrid UI. From 10:45 AM PST to 11:50 AM PST customers accessing the legacy SendGrid UI may not have been able to log into their consoles as 2FA verification codes via SMS or Authy app were not recognized. Unified accounts were not affected by the situation. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Mail Delivery Delays in Asia Pacific Region

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with mail delivery delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time, so we'll close this incident to Resolved. Thank you for your understanding.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance, we are seeing an improved performance overall and all messages are now being delivered without any delay. We will provide another update within the next minutes once we can confirm the issue has been resolved correctly.

Our engineers have identified the root cause of the issue and continue testing possible fixes. At this time, customers could have experienced delays in Asia Pacific mail send requests from 1:24 am PT to 2:06am. New traffic continues to be swung away from Asia Pacific, and we do not expect delays to new mail sends after 2:06am PT. The stuck mails were all delivered by 6:12am PDT. Additionally, we identified another impact for degraded mail send API availability from 1:24am PDT to 2:52am PDT. It's mitigated by further swinging traffic away from Oceania at 2:48am PDT

We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team have identified mail delivery delays occurring in the Asia Pacific region. We are actively working to resolve. As a result, these emails may experience extended delivery times. We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates while we work to clear the backlog.
